summary: An email from July 24, 2019, raising concerns about preferential treatment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The email questions special arrangements for Epstein's meals and restroom escorts while he was in attorney conferences, contrasting them with standard procedures for other inmates.

keyFacts: An email dated July 24, 2019, raises allegations of preferential treatment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
The email questions why Epstein's meals were to be delivered to the attorney conference room for every feeding, unlike other inmates who receive a standard bagged lunch.
It also questions why Epstein was to be escorted to the restroom every hour without restraints, despite being a Special Housing Unit (SHU) inmate.
The sender implies these procedures constitute clear preferential treatment not afforded to other inmates.
